title: Davenport constant
summary: In mathematics, the Davenport constant D(G ) is an invariant of a group studied in additive combinatorics, quantifying the size of nonunique factorizations.  Given a finite abelian group G, D(G ) is defined as the smallest number such that every sequence of elements of that length contains a non-empty subsequence adding up to 0.  In symbols, this is[1]
